go_data.justification: CD40 interacts directly with TRAFs via a short stretch of amino acids within their cytoplasmic tails.
TRAF2 mediates NF-kappaB activation induced by CD40.
CD40 plays a role in the activation of signaling pathways induced by these receptors.
CD40 is a receptor that interacts with TRAFs via its cytoplasmic tail, implying it is located at the cell surface.
